overview: This measure finalizes the Judiciary's budget for the 2025-2027 fiscal biennium, appropriating funds for both operating expenses and capital improvement projects. It establishes the specific operating budget totals for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027, which were not detailed in the previous version of the bill. The measure also confirms the capital improvement funding of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) for fiscal year 2025-2026.
appropriations: The final version of the bill appropriates general funds for operating costs amounting to $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1) for fiscal year 2026-2027. These amounts provide the Judiciary's finalized operating budget for the biennium. The measure also confirms a capital improvement appropriation of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) in general obligation bonds for FY 2025-2026.
agency_impact: The finalized operating budget appropriations of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2026-2027 will determine the Judiciary's staffing, programs, and service levels for the biennium. These figures provide the agency with a concrete financial framework for operational planning. The agency will also move forward with managing the capital improvement projects funded by the $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) appropriation.
policy_impact: This final version of the budget solidifies the legislature's funding priorities for the Judiciary for the next two years. By setting specific operating fund levels, the measure directly impacts the Judiciary's capacity to administer justice and manage its operations. The bill reaffirms the policy of investing in court infrastructure by finalizing the capital improvement budget for the biennium.
revenue_sources: The Judiciary's operating budget is now set to be funded primarily by General Fund appropriations of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2026-2027. Capital improvement projects will be funded through the issuance of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) in general obligation bonds. These funding sources are finalized in this conference draft.
six_year_fiscal_implications: This measure establishes the Judiciary's baseline operating budget for the next two years, with General Fund appropriations of $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2026-2027. These totals will serve as the foundation for budget requests in subsequent biennia. The total operating budget from all means of finance is set at $214,571,429 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2025-2026 and $212,425,098 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2026-2027. The capital improvement appropriation of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2025-2026 will create long-term fiscal obligations in the form of debt service payments. Projects funded by this appropriation will likely necessitate future funding requests for construction and will add to recurring operational and maintenance costs beyond the six-year period.
capital_expenditure_impact: This measure finalizes the capital improvement expenditure for the Judiciary at $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) for fiscal year 2025-2026. This entire amount is funded through the issuance of general obligation bonds. This appropriation confirms the total capital budget discussed in the previous version of the bill.
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The primary update from the previous fiscal note is the finalization of the Judiciary's operating budget for the 2025-2027 fiscal biennium, which was not previously specified. The measure now appropriates General Funds for operations totaling $201,725,676 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2025-2026 and $199,579,345 (HB400_CD1) for FY 2026-2027. This conference draft also formally confirms the capital improvement appropriation of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) in general obligation bond funds for FY 2025-2026.

sentence.text: The measure also confirms the capital improvement funding of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) for fiscal year 2025-2026.
sentence.clean_text: The measure also confirms the capital improvement funding of $12,900,000  for fiscal year 2025-2026.

chunk.text:
SECTION 6. Provided that the judiciary may transfer savings from its general fund
appropriation to the driver education and training fund to accommodate any
temporary cash flow deficits. SECTION 7. Provided that of the general fund appropriation for administration
(JUD601), the sum of $2,218,922 or so much thereof as may be necessary for
fiscal year 2025-2026 shall be expended for salary adjustments as recommended
by the commission on salaries; provided further that the chief justice may
transfer funds between programs to implement any salary adjustments as
recommended by the commission on salaries. PART IV. CAPITAL IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS
SECTION 8. The sum of $12,900,000 appropriated or authorized in part II of this Act
for capital improvement projects shall be expended by the judiciary for the
projects listed below; provided that several related or similar projects may be
combined into a single project, if a combination is advantageous or convenient
for implementation; provided further that the total cost of the projects thus
combined shall not exceed the total of the sums specified for the projects
separately.

chunk.text:
1,
S.D. 2, entitled:
"A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE JUDICIARY,"
having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed
to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of
this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to appropriate funds for the
operating and capital improvement costs of the Judiciary for the fiscal
biennium beginning on July 1, 2025, and ending on June 30, 2027. As introduced,
this budget measure appropriated:
Operating
FY 2025-2026
FY 2026-2027
GENERAL FUNDS
203,319,009
203,391,600
ALL MEANS OF FINANCE
216,164,762
216,237,353
Capital Improvements
FY 2025-2026
FY 2026-2027
GENERAL FUNDS
0
0
GENERAL OBLIGATION BONDS
9,900,000
0
ALL MEANS OF FINANCE
9,900,000
0
Your Committee on
Conference has amended this measure by:
(1)
Inserting appropriate operating and capital
improvement amounts for fiscal biennium 2025-2027;
(2)
Changing the effective date to July 1, 2025;
and
(3)
Making
technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency,
and style.

sentence.text: The measure also confirms a capital improvement appropriation of $12,900,000 (HB400_CD1) in general obligation bonds for FY 2025-2026.
sentence.clean_text: The measure also confirms a capital improvement appropriation of $12,900,000  in general obligation bonds for FY 2025-2026.

chunk.text:
General obligation bonds may be issued, as provided by law, to yield the
amount that may be necessary to finance projects authorized in part II and
listed in part IV of this Act; provided that the sum total of the general
obligation bonds so issued shall not exceed $12,900,000
. PART VI. SPECIAL PROVISIONS
SECTION 10. Any law or any provision of this Act to the contrary notwithstanding,
the appropriations made for capital improvement projects authorized in part II
and listed in part IV of this Act shall not lapse at the end of the fiscal year
for which the appropriations are made; provided that all appropriations made
for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027 that are unencumbered as of
June 30, 2028, shall lapse as of that date. SECTION 11. The judiciary may delegate to other state or county agencies the
planning, acquisition of land, design, construction, and equipment of any
capital improvement project when it is determined by the judiciary to be advantageous
to do so. SECTION 12.
